page.title: 02THE CANAL
page.content: THE CANAL THAT RUNS NEAR OUR SCHOOLIS THE{BRIDGEWATER CANAL}MADE BY {JAMES {BRINDLEY.}THE CANAL IS NO LONGER USED FOR CARRYING GOODS BECAUSE OF TRAINS AND ROADS. THE CANAL IS ONLY USED BY FISHERMEN AND PLEASURE BOATS. DOWN THE CANAL A BIT, THERE IS A BOATYARD BUT NOW IT IS ONLY USED AS A MOORING PLACE. FURTHER UP THE CANAL, THERE IS AN AQUEDUCT OVER THE CANAL. IT HAS GOT TWO ARCHES AND IT IS THE ORIGINAL BECAUDE IT HAS GOT A PLAQUE ON THE SIDE, BUT IT IS SO RUSTY THAT YOU CAN'T READ IT. THERE ARE A LOT OF BOATS MOORED UP AND QUITE A FEW ARE NARROW BOATS. UNDER THE BRIDGE THERE ARE A LOT OF PLANTS IN THE CANAL AND ON THE TOW PATH.NO-ONE GOES SWIMMING IN THE CANAL.THERE ARE SOME FISH IN THE CANAL,BUT NOT MANY. BEN WAITE
